SEARCH
Package com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.dto.mail

Class MailDto

java.lang.Object
com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.dto.mail.MailDto
public class MailDto extends Object
Data Transfer Object for mail messages. This class encapsulates the details of a mail message, including sender and receiver information, message content, and status flags for seen and deletion states.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a new MailDto with specified details.
    MailDto(String subject, String text, String senderName, String senderMail, String receiverName, String receiverMail)
    Constructs a new MailDto with essential details, excluding sender and receiver photos.

  • Constructor Details

    • MailDto

      public MailDto()
      Default constructor.

    • MailDto

      public MailDto(int id, String subject, String text, LocalDateTime date, String senderName, String senderMail, String senderPhoto, String receiverName, String receiverMail, String receiverPhoto, boolean seen, boolean isDeletedBySender, boolean isDeletedByReceiver)
      Constructs a new MailDto with specified details.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the mail.
      subject - The subject of the mail.
      text - The text content of the mail.
      date - The date and time the mail was sent.
      senderName - The name of the sender.
      senderMail - The email address of the sender.
      senderPhoto - The photo URL of the sender.
      receiverName - The name of the receiver.
      receiverMail - The email address of the receiver.
      receiverPhoto - The photo URL of the receiver.
      seen - Flag indicating if the mail has been seen by the receiver.
      isDeletedBySender - Flag indicating if the mail has been deleted by the sender.
      isDeletedByReceiver - Flag indicating if the mail has been deleted by the receiver.

    • MailDto

      public MailDto(String subject, String text, String senderName, String senderMail, String receiverName, String receiverMail)
      Constructs a new MailDto with essential details, excluding sender and receiver photos.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject of the mail.
      text - The text content of the mail.
      senderName - The name of the sender.
      senderMail - The email address of the sender.
      receiverName - The name of the receiver.
      receiverMail - The email address of the receiver.
